icon.name: warning_ui_size
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using 'small' or 'big' interface size requires a restart. The UI is not designed for the 'small' or 'big' size, you may encounter problems.

icon.name: warning_font_dpi
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using a different DPI other than 96 may cause clipping text, broken labels, spacing issues and broken layouts, use with caution.

icon.name: warning_texture_memory
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Too high texture memory may cause drastic negative performance impact. Too low texture memory will cause faster texture trashing issues.

icon.name: warning_texture_compression
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using texture compression will save some texture memory but at a massive negative performance impact while loading textures and possible overarll as the Viewer spends most of its time processing textures.

check_box.label: Borderless Window Mode
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle between borderless window mode and normal window mode
check_box.name: FullscreenWindow

check_box.label: Custom Memory
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle if the Viewer should use the default Texture Memory calculation or if you should be able to set Scene and System memory invidually.
check_box.name: CustomSystemMemory

check_box.label: Enable OpenGL 3.0 Texture Compression
check_box.tool_tip: Enable texture compression on OpenGL 2.1 and later implementations which should reduce video memory bloat (Experimental, requires restart)
check_box.name: CompressTextures

icon.name: warning_dynamic_lod
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Disabling Dynamic Level of Detail will make the overall object quality equally dependant on the 'Object Quality' setting, all objects will use the same level of detail no matter their distance to the camera.

icon.name: warning_object_lod
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Object Quality beyond 'medium' may have a negative impact on performance especially with sculpts and meshes.

check_box.label: Use Dynamic Level of Detail
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles dynamic Level-of-Detail which automatically adjusts the detail of meshes, prims and sculpts on increasing distance. Can boost your performance but should be kept off if you want to have all objects on a 'full-rezzed' like state at all times _____________________________________ Graphics +++ | Performance ─ ─ ─ Graphics ++ | Performance ─ ─ ─ Graphics + | Performance ─ ─ ─
check_box.name: DynamicLOD

check_box.label: Enable Avatar Physics Simulation
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles Avatar Physics on or off, causing breasts aswell as butts and stomachs to simulate physical movement and interaction with gravity.
check_box.name: AvatarPhysics

check_box.label: Use Water Mip-maps
check_box.tool_tip: Use Mip-maps on distance for water (blurrier/low resolution textures to prevent usage of high resolution textures on distance which results in extreme water pixelation)
check_box.name: MipMaps

icon.name: warning_object_occlusion
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Object-Object Occlusion may cause overall performance degradation in combination with Deferred Rendering, its gains are negligible in open but can be quite heavy in enclosed areas.

icon.name: warning_avatars_visible
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: A lot maximum visible avatars on screen may cause absolutely unusable performance depending on hardware, Deferred Rendering and the detail of said avatars

icon.name: warning_derender_kb
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Heavy weight avatars (in KB) may cause a lot of traffic, high performance degradation and quick texture trashing.

icon.name: warning_derender_m2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Avatars with a lot of attachment surface (in m²) may cause high performance degradation and even crash you as high square meters are often a possible indicator for graphic crashers.

icon.name: warning_derender_ar
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: High complexity avatars (AR) may cause high performance degradation, quick texture trashing, unstable framerates and possibly even freezes or crashes in combination with Deferred Rendering depending on your hardware.

icon.name: warning_derender_surface
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: High surface areas are often used for crashing purposes, everything beyond 200m² can safely be ignored as its very likely that it is of malicious nature.

icon.name: warning_draw_distance
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Draw Distance has a high impact on performance, high draw distances may cause the Viewer to become virtually unusable, especially in combination with weak hardware and Deferred Rendering.

slider.label: Draw Distance:
slider.name: FarClip
slider.tool_tip: Controls the view distance of Objects starting from your avatar in meters

slider.label: Particle Amount:
slider.name: MaxParticles
slider.tool_tip: Controls the maximum amount of Particles rendered on screen.

check_box.label: Render Attached Particles
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles rendering of particles which are attached to your or other Avatars on or off. Usefull for particle spammers
check_box.name: attached_particles

check_box.label: Enable Anisotropic Filtering
check_box.tool_tip: Allows Anisotropic Filtering to unblur textures in certain camera angles
check_box.name: ani

check_box.label: Enable Fullbright
check_box.tool_tip: Tell the Viewer to ignore the Fullbright flags on Object creation resulting in no Fullbrights until restart/revisit - WARNING! , does not work with Objects that use an old set prim attribute LIGHT script command!
check_box.name: EnableFullbright

check_box.label: Use Object-Object Occlusion
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles Occlusion which prevents objects behind other objects beeing rendered which can boost your performance depending on how much it is used in the scene e.g in empty places it will just hurt your performance rather than increasing it.
check_box.name: UseOcclusion

check_box.label: Use Stream Draw
check_box.name: vbostream
check_box.tool_tip: Dynamic draw updates per frame, Stream draw per render. Driver/GPU tweak may alter Graphics Bandwidth

check_box.label: Use Plugin Read Thread
check_box.tool_tip: Use a seperate Thread to read incoming messages from Plugins like Webprims etc.
check_box.name: PluginUseReadThread

check_box.label: Use Far Clip
check_box.tool_tip: Switches between the normal Camera Mode where Objects get derendered when moving your Camera away from them and a more -from Avatar- like rendering method where everything until your Render Range gets rendered no matter if you are zooming away
check_box.name: RenderUseFarClip

slider.label: Background Yield Time:
slider.tool_tip: Set the amount of time in ms which the Viewer should be held back when not beeing focused , 40 equals ~18 FPS
slider.name: BackgroundYieldTime

slider.label: Max. Avatars Visible:
slider.tool_tip: Controls the maximum amount of Avatars rendered on screen
slider.name: RenderAvatarMaxVisible

icon.name: warning_reflection_quality
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Higher than 'normal' Reflection Quality may noticably impact performance negatively.

icon.name: warning_sky_quality
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Higher than 'high' Sky Quality may have a slight negative impact on performance without any noticable visual improvements.

check_box.label: Deferred Rendering
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles Deferred Rendering adding shadows cast by and on Prims, Avatars and the World aswell as uses a new lighting which allows Projected Lights/Textures which can also drop shadows. Vertex Shader, Atmospheric Shader, Post Process Glow and Hardware Skinning are needed to use this!
check_box.name: Deferred

icon.name: warning_fxaa
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: FXAA has basically zero impact on performance, not using it will cause aliasing on edges and may impact overall visual fidelity negatively.

icon.name: warning_shadow_resolution
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Shadow resolutions beyond 2048 may have a huge negative impact on performance depending on the complexity of the scene.

icon.name: warning_projector_resolution
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Projector resolutions beyond 2048 may have a slight to medium impact on performance.

icon.name: warning_ssr
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Screen Space Reflections may cause drastic performance degradation depending on the surface it is rendered on and the SSR Resolution used.

check_box.label: Render Deferred Lights
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles normal lights and projected lights in Deferred Rendering on or off altogether. Warning this might also disable lights in Windlight!
check_box.name: RenderLocalLights

check_box.label: Render Attached Lights
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles rendering of lights which are attached to your or other Avatars on or off. Useful for annoying facelights
check_box.name: RenderAttachedLights

slider.label: Extended Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: Additionally increase the distance you can see shadows, decreases overall shadow precision
slider.name: RenderShadowFarClip

slider.label: Closeup Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: Set the width and height of the closeup shadowmap
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_X

slider.label: Close Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: Set the width and height of the close shadowmap
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_Y

slider.label: Far Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: Set the width and height of the far shadowmap
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_Z

slider.label: Distant Shadowmap Size:
slider.tool_tip: Set the width and height of the furthest shadowmap
slider.name: RenderShadowResolution_W

slider.label: Projector Shadow Width:
slider.tool_tip: Set the width of the projector shadowmap
slider.name: RenderProjectorShadowResolution_X

slider.label: Projector Shadow Height:
slider.tool_tip: Set the height of the projector shadowmap
slider.name: RenderProjectorShadowResolution_Y

slider.label: Resolution Multiplicator:
slider.tool_tip: Set the multiplicator value for width and height of the projector shadowmap
slider.name: RenderProjectorShadowResolution_Z

check_box.label: Light Softening
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles Shadow, SSAO and Light Softening, blurs shadows and ssao to make them look smooth, might have a slight impact on overall look of the lighting in deferred without Shadows or SSAO enabled.
check_box.name: RenderDeferredBlurLight

check_box.label: Use Fast Light Softening
check_box.tool_tip: Use a static, but much faster blur light shader, disables the ability to customize the blur light quality
check_box.name: RenderDeferredBlurLight

slider.label: Soften Blur Size:
slider.tool_tip: Set the strength of each blur pass
slider.name: RenderShadowBlurSize

check_box.label: Render Screen Space Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles Screen Space Reflections on shiny surfaces creating very realistic reflective surfaces but will need a monstrous PC
check_box.name: RenderScreenSpaceReflections

check_box.label: Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO)
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles SSAO which adds small dark edges and transitions to close objects making them look more realistic.
check_box.name: UseSSAO

slider.label: SSAO Blur Size:
slider.tool_tip: Set the strength of each blur pass of SSAO
slider.name: RenderSSAOBlurSize

check_box.label: Depth of Field
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles a camera like Depth of Field effect on or off, often used to blur out distance or things that shouldnt be in focus
check_box.name: UseDoF

check_box.label: Enable Alphas in Depth of Field calculations
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle if the Viewer should include alphas and particles into the depth map (can cause some erratic behavior with Depth of Field blurring on Alphas and Volumetric Lighting on Alphas). If disabled this will cause Depth of Field and Volumetric Lighting to ignore Alphas entirely and they will change their lighting back to as if Depth of Field is disabled.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldAlphas

slider.label: Field of View(°):
slider.name: CameraFOV
slider.tool_tip: Vertical camera field of view for Depth of Field effect (in degrees)

slider.label: F-Number:
slider.name: CameraFNum
slider.tool_tip: Camera f-number value for Depth of Field effect

slider.label: Focal Length(mm):
slider.name: CameraFocal
slider.tool_tip: Camera focal length for Depth of Field effect (in millimeters)

slider.label: Circle of Confusion:
slider.name: CameraCoF
slider.tool_tip: Set the Camera circle of confusion

slider.label: Focus Transition Time(s):
slider.name: CameraFocusTrans
slider.tool_tip: Time taken to alter focus from one place to the next

slider.label: Resolution Scale:
slider.name: CameraDoFRes
slider.tool_tip: Set the Resolution (Quality) of each DoF pixel

check_box.label: Motion Blur
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles if fast movement should be blurred
check_box.name: MotionBlur

icon.name: warning_blur_quality
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Motion Blur may look very blurry with a low Motion Blur Quality setting.

check_box.label: Volumetric Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles if experimental volumetric light should be rendered, causing godrays in certain circumstances
check_box.name: RenderGodrays

icon.name: warning_light_resolution
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: A high light resolution may have medium performance impact depending on the scene and shadow resolution.

check_box.label: Directional Volumetric Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle if Volumtric Lighting should fade out the further you look away from the Sun. Mimics original Godrays behavior a bit.
check_box.name: RenderGodraysDirectional

check_box.label: Lens Flare Effect
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles the sun light reflection on your camera on or off.
check_box.name: LensFlare

check_box.label: Tone Mapping
check_box.tool_tip: Toggles if Tone Mapping should be used while Deferred Rendering is active, it might cause the whole scene to look more/less colorfull and increase/decrease the overall scene brightness difference making the scene look dull
check_box.name: ToneMapping
